text: If you're looking to increase the size
of your Fortnite locker with an addition
of a new skin entirely free,

there are a couple methods
you may find beneficial.
In this video, we will show you
how to get skins through Winterfest,
tournaments, and battle passes.
Use our clickable sections below
to keep track of what step you're on
during this tutorial.
Annually during the holiday season,
or as Fortnite refers to it, Winterfest,
free items are granted to those
who log in to play once per day.
Winterfest lasts two weeks on average,
totaling 14 gifts entirely free.
Gifts can include anything from emotes
to holiday-themed skins.

A few examples include
Snowmando, Frost Squad,
and the peppermint pick.

Periodically, Fortnite
will host tournaments
accessible to all players,

and if you place within a
predetermined percentage
of all participants,

you are rewarded early
access to cosmetic items,
free of charge.

Examples include Venom,
Lachlan, and Thanos.
Tournament rules vary,

so be sure to read through
the provided details
of each tournament.

Next, we will cover Fortnite
skins that are deemed free
after a small initial investment.

In tandem with the release of
every new season in Fortnite,
a brand-new battle pass becomes available.
Battle passes bring with them an abundance
of new unlockable items, including skins.

Each battle pass is listed
at a price of 950 V-bucks,
which translates to a total of $8.
Beyond this initial investment,

all skins and cosmetics in the
battle pass are free to earn.
Upon leveling up in-game,

whether through quests or
simply from performing well,
players are given battle stars.
These battle stars can then be used

to progress your way
through the battle pass
and unlock your favorite skins.

Battle pass owners are also
presented with the ability
to unlock a secret skin once per season.
The secret skin is uncovered

typically 10 weeks from
the start of the season.
In order to earn the secret skin,
you must complete a specific set of quests
provided to players.
